abstract: As chairman of the Standard Oil Company of California in the 1980s, Mr. Keller executed what was then the largest corporate takeover ever, in a deal that formed Chevron.
snippet: As chairman of the Standard Oil Company of California in the 1980s, Mr. Keller executed what was then the largest corporate takeover ever, in a deal that formed Chevron.
lead_paragraph: George M. Keller, who as chairman of the Standard Oil Company of California in the 1980s executed what was then the largest corporate takeover ever, a deal in which Socal swallowed Gulf Oil to form an even bigger oil company, Chevron, died Friday in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 84.

headline.main: George M. Keller, Whose Wager Created Chevron, Is Dead at 84
headline.print_headline: George Keller, 84, Oil Chief Whose Deal Made Chevron
